ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: In it there is a flowing spring called Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: From a spring by the name of Ever-flowing-Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: drawn from a spring (in Paradise) called Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Which is a spring in Paradise called Salsabeel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (Of) a fountain therein which is named Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: therein a fountain whose name is called Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (The water of) a spring therein, named Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: from a flowing spring called Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: From a fountain therein, named Salsabil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: from a spring in it named Salsabeel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:18] a spring (‘aynan substitutes for zanjabīlan, ‘ginger’) therein named Salsabīl, meaning that its water is like ginger, which the Arabs find very tasteful, [and which is] very palatable for the throat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: The water of a spring therein) in the Garden, (named Salsabil.
